alert.note: Alert for Allegany; Cattaraugus; Chautauqua; Genesee; Livingston; Monroe; Niagara; Northern Erie; Orleans; Southern Erie; Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 7:16PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WYOMING...CATTARAUGUS...ERIE... SOUTHWESTERN LIVINGSTON...NIAGARA...ORLEANS...SOUTHEASTERN CHAUTAUQUA...ALLEGANY...NORTHWESTERN MONROE AND GENESEE COUNTIES THROUGH 845 PM EDT... At 713 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 36 miles west of Niagara Falls to Ripley. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 60 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, Niagara Falls, West Seneca, North Tonawanda, Clarence, Lockport, Lackawanna, Batavia, Kenmore, Depew, Amherst, Tonawanda, Olean, Lancaster, Hamburg, East Aurora, Medina, Albion, and Salamanca. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between exits 47 and 57A. Interstate 86 between exits 15 and 31. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Allegany; Cattaraugus; Chautauqua; Genesee; Livingston; Monroe; Niagara; Northern Erie; Orleans; Southern Erie; Wyoming
